elements.title: Adam Berdichevsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Adam Berdichevsky (pictured) represented Israel at the 2024 Paris Paralympics, eleven months after he and his family survived the 7 October Hamas-led attack on Israel?

elements.title: The Anacrusis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the science-fiction video game The Anacrusis is named after a musical term?

elements.title: M503 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that to protest changes to the flight route M503, Taiwan cancelled 176 flights between China and Taiwan?

elements.title: ComicBook.com (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ComicBook.com originally began as a website with sales links and press releases before becoming an entertainment news site?

elements.title: Ibsen Nelsen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Dust Bowl refugee Ibsen Nelsen received the Purple Heart and became a fellow of the American Institute of Architects?

elements.title: National Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chișinău's National Hotel was once a flagship property but is now effectively abandoned?

elements.title: Joe Hisaishi has been awarded (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the composer Joe Hisaishi has been awarded eight Japan Academy Film Prizes and nominated for eight more?

elements.title: Fedora (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one commentator interpreted a kiss between two women in "Fedora" as possibly following the "heteronormative script"?

elements.title: September 11 Digital Archive (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the September 11 Digital Archive argues that even its misinformation is useful to the historical record?
